meanings.definition: The wealth and resources of a country or region, especially in terms of production and consumption of goods and services.
meanings.sent1: In some economies, people make things and buy things to help their country.
meanings.sent2: The global economies are interconnected, affecting each other's prosperity.
meanings.sent3: The economy of the tiny village was so small that everyone knew everyone else's business.
meanings.sent4: Her savings were like a tiny economy, carefully managed and growing over time.
meanings.sent5: The economy of the bustling city was a vibrant tapestry of businesses and transactions.

meanings.definition: The careful management of available resources.
meanings.sent1: She practiced economy by using only what she needed and not wasting anything.
meanings.sent2: Good economy at home meant turning off lights when not in use to save electricity.
meanings.sent3: His economy of time allowed him to finish all his tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent4: Her economy of words made her messages clear and impactful.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel's economy in gathering nuts for winter impressed the other animals.

meanings.definition: The system or range of economic activity in a particular area.
meanings.sent1: The local economy relied heavily on tourism for income.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the economy of a region helps in making informed business decisions.
meanings.sent3: The economy of the school cafeteria was booming with the new menu items.
meanings.sent4: The economy of the online marketplace was like a digital ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The economy of the small town flourished with the opening of a new factory.
